method.name: Generational GA with binary coding scheme for filter feature selection with the inconsistency rate

reference.ref: H. Liu and R. Setiono. A Probabilistic Approach to Feature Selection: A Filter Solution. 13th International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML'96). Bari (Italy, 1996) 319-327.

generalDescription.objective: Feature Selection. This method allows search to follow feature subsets.
generalDescription.howWork:
FS-GGA-Binary-Inconsistency is a generational genetic algorithm with binary representation
This method uses a k-tournament selection, the one point crossover operator and one point binary mutation operator.
The stopping criteria used is the number of evaluations and the fitness function: (1-alfa)*inconsistency_rate + alfa*features_selected

parameterSpec.param: paramKNN: is the number of nearest neighbours used by the k-NN classifier
nEval: is the number of evaluations that performs the genetic algorithm
alfa: is a real value used in the fitness function. This parameter weigh up the precision rate and the feature reduction
popLength: is the size of the population
k: is the number of best features selected before applying the random tournament to selected one of them
